sentence: His announcement now reduces the field vying for GOP nomination in the May 17 primary to: Lou Barletta of Luzerne County, Shawn Berger of Carbon County, Guy Ciarrocchi of Chester County, Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman of Centre County, Montgomery County Commissioner Joe Gale, Charlie Gerow of Cumberland County, Melissa Hart of Allegheny County, Sen. Scott Martin of Lancaster County, Sen. Doug Mastriano of Franklin County, William McSwain of Chester County, Jason Richey of Allegheny County, John Ventre of Westmoreland County, Dave White, and Dr. Nche Zama of Northampton County.
title: Former Pa. House Speaker Mike Turzai declares he is not running for governor

sentence: The candidate, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, who ran unsuccessfully for Senate in 2018, continued to maintain the Leaders Only Unite PAC, or LOU PAC, after leaving the House in 2019.
author: Daniel Marans
title: Pennsylvania Republican Lou Barletta’s PAC Spent Most Of Its Money On Overhead

sentence: He was followed by Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman of Centre County with 12 votes; GOP strategist and public relations firm CEO Charlie Gerow with seven; Chester County Chamber of Business and Industry CEO Guy Ciarrocchi, with five; former congressman Lou Barletta of Luzerne County, with four; and Dr. Nche Zama, a retired cardiothoracic surgeon from Northampton County, with one vote.
title: Last of GOP regional straw polls hand victories to Bartos, White for U.S. Senate, governor

sentence: Former congressman and leading Republican gubernatorial candidate Lou Barletta (R-PA) told Breitbart News Saturday that as governor, he will use all powers available to him to stop illegal immigration, noting that many in the GOP do not have the backbone to stand against the radical left’s illegal immigration policies.
author: Hannah Bleau
title: Exclusive — Gubernatorial Candidate Lou Barletta: Illegal Immigration ‘Ends When I’m Governor of Pennsylvania’

sentence: Former congressman Lou Barletta, state Senate President Pro Tempore Jake Corman, former U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain and former Delaware County councilman Dave White won’t take part in any debate that is not moderated by a Republican who lives in the state.
title: Editorial: GOP candidates should embrace better debates

sentence: Tim Murtaugh, an advisor to gubernatorial competitor Lou Barletta, told the publication that Mastriano’s proposal was a “dangerous idea.” “Directing the government to broadcast the personal medical information of private citizens is a dangerous idea that should never even be considered,” Murtaugh said.
author: Katherine Hamilton
title: Report: Pennsylvania State Sen. Doug Mastriano Wanted Government to Publicly Report Identities of Everyone Who Got Coronavirus

sentence: Corman’s withdrawal still would have left eight Republican candidates vying for the party’s nomination, including McSwain, former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, state Sen. Doug Mastriano and former Delaware County Councilman Dave White.
author: The Philadelphia Inquirer
title: Jake Corman is staying in the Republican race for Pennsylvania governor after moving to drop out

sentence: GOP candidates not participating include former U.S. Rep. Lou Barletta, state Sen. Doug Mastriano, former U.S. Attorney Bill McSwain and Delaware County business owner Dave White.
author: Paula Reed Ward
title: Trib Total Media co-sponsoring debate in Pa.'s hotly contested GOP primary race for governor
